definition: to carry on one's ancestral line
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
surname Zong
school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: Are the women a tool for reproduction?
sentences.chinese: 女人是传宗接代的工具吗？

sentences.english: One of a man's life missions is to produce a son to continue the family name.
sentences.chinese: 男人生命中的一项任务就是生个儿子传宗接代。

definition: to bear and raise children
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
son/heir
to take a concubine
to look after one's aged parents and arrange proper burial after they die
to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
lit. one husband one wife/monogamy
There are three ways to be unfilial; having no sons is the worst. (citation from Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3])
pinyin: bu4 xiao4 you3 san1 , wu2 hou4 wei2 da4

definition: to get married (of woman)
to marry and live with the bride's family (inverting traditional Chinese expectations)
the more sons, the more happiness (idiom)
to value males and attach less importance to females (idiom)
to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
descendant/progeny/posterity/later ages/later generations
